    Johannes Zirngibl

    PhD candidate and research associate at the Technical University of Munich

    Welcome

    I am a research associate and PhD candidate at the Chair of Network Architecures and Services at the Technical University of Munich

    I focus on large scale analysis and measurements targeting the Internet. My core areas are the analysis of network deployments and their peculiarities. My work relies on multiple protocols spanning networking layers, such as IPv6, DNS, TLS, QUIC.

    The goal is to reach a better understanding of the Internet and understand the impact of often disregarded influences such as Off-Net deployments.

    I am part of the Global Internet Observatory (GINO), a interest group at our chair focusing on Internet measurements.

    • Domain Parking: Largely Present, Rarely Considered!

      Johannes Zirngibl, Steffen Deusch, Patrick Sattler, Juliane Aulbach, Georg Carle, Mattijs Jonker, "Domain Parking: Largely Present, Rarely Considered!." Proc. Network Traffic Measurement and Analysis Conference (TMA), 2022.

    • Rusty Clusters? Dusting an IPv6 Research Foundation

      Johannes Zirngibl, Lion Steger, Patrick Sattler, Oliver Gasser, Georg Carle, "Rusty Clusters? Dusting an IPv6 Research Foundation." Proc. ACM Int. Measurement Conference (IMC), 2022.
